# Ingress

comments.body: careful about suggesting it supports SSL

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +83,87 @@```

It can be configured to give services externally-reachable urls, load balance traffic, terminate SSL, offer name based virtual hosting etc. Users request ingress by POSTing the Ingress resource to the API server. An [Ingress controller](#ingress-controllers) is responsible for fulfilling the Ingress, usually with a loadbalancer, though it may also configure your edge router or additional frontends to help handle the traffic in an HA manner.

## The Ingress Resource

comments.body: munge inserts example for you. So you may remove this.
That's unfortunate, I actually want those line numbers for the explanation that follows. I'll move my Download example to the next one.
Add comments and reference blocks instead of lines?

I prefer showing a working config in its entirety and explaning the whole thing. IMO yaml comments work better when you want to draw attention to something, not explain how it works. I could do it in 2 phases where i show the whole thing, then chunk it up to explain, if you'd prefer that I'll do it when i send the follow up pr explaining the controller.
